docs.lead_paragraph: Officials, families and media reports have named some of the 20 foreign tourists killed in the Tunis museum attack. Here is a partial list of the victims who have been identified so far.

headline.print_headline: Some Tunis Museum Attack Victims Identified

docs.snippet: Officials, families and media reports have named some of the 20 foreign tourists killed in the Tunis museum attack. Here is a partial list of the victims who have been identified so far.

docs.lead_paragraph: Several free iOS and Android apps offer various ways to track and encourage exercise.

headline.main: Video Feature: Apps for Tracking Fitness and Losing Weight
headline.print_headline: Help With Tracking Fitness and Losing Weight

docs.abstract: Kit Eaton App Smart column compares variety of different fitness and weight-loss apps; recommends to-do-list app Wunderlist.

docs.lead_paragraph: A judge dismissed a lawsuit by Herbalife shareholders who claimed that the business structure and marketing practices of the weight loss and nutritional supplements company violated the law and that they lost money because it amounts to a pyramid scheme.

headline.main: Supplement Company Herbalife Sees Pyramid-Scheme Suit Tossed
headline.print_headline: Supplement Company Herbalife Sees Pyramid-Scheme Suit Tossed

docs.snippet: A judge dismissed a lawsuit by Herbalife shareholders who claimed that the business structure and marketing practices of the weight loss and nutritional supplements company violated the law and that they lost money because it amounts to a pyramid...

docs.lead_paragraph: There are numerous calorie counters and exercise tracking apps available. Let your phone be your guide to better fitness and nutrition.

headline.main: App Smart | Tech Your Way To Fitness

docs.snippet: There are numerous calorie counters and exercise tracking apps available. Let your phone be your guide to better fitness and nutrition.

docs.lead_paragraph: Herbalife Ltd won the dismissal of a lawsuit that claimed the maker of weight-loss and nutritional products fraudulently portrayed itself as a legitimate company, and that shareholders lost money because it was actually an illegal pyramid scheme.

headline.main: Herbalife Wins Dismissal of U.S. 'Pyramid Scheme' Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: Herbalife Wins Dismissal of U.S. 'Pyramid Scheme' Lawsuit

docs.snippet: Herbalife Ltd won the dismissal of a lawsuit that claimed the maker of weight-loss and nutritional products fraudulently portrayed itself as a legitimate company, and that shareholders lost money because it was actually an illegal pyramid scheme.

docs.lead_paragraph: Jarome Iginla draws the blackout curtains and keeps his room at a cool temperature. He silences his cellphone and sometimes reads a relaxing book to drift off.

headline.main: Evidence Suggests NHL, NBA Warmups May Not Be a Good Thing
headline.print_headline: Evidence Suggests NHL, NBA Warmups May Not Be a Good Thing

docs.lead_paragraph: The Republicans’ proposed budget partly privatizes Medicare, turns Medicaid into block grants to the states, repeals the Affordable Care Act and reaches balance in 10 years.

headline.main: House Republicans Propose Budget With Deep Cuts
headline.print_headline: Republicans Propose Budget With Deep Cuts

docs.abstract: Congressional Republicans introduce budget that slashes spending by $5.5 trillion over 10 years, balancing federal budget without raising taxes; plan relies on number of contortions, including deep cuts to federal programs, elimination of Affordable Care Act and assumptions of economic growth based on plan itself, in order to achieve aim while adding $40 billion in defense spending.
docs.snippet: The Republicans’ proposed budget partly privatizes Medicare, turns Medicaid into block grants to the states, repeals the Affordable Care Act and reaches balance in 10 years.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: France's lower house of Parliament approved a bill Tuesday that allows doctors to keep terminally ill patients sedated until death comes — a move sure to ignite more debate about end-of-life practices.

headline.main: French Lawmakers OK Terminal Sedation, Not Euthanasia
headline.print_headline: French Lawmakers OK Terminal Sedation, Not Euthanasia

docs.snippet: France's lower house of Parliament approved a bill Tuesday that allows doctors to keep terminally ill patients sedated until death comes — a move sure to ignite more debate about end-of-life practices.

docs.lead_paragraph: French food group Danone does not need to make a large acquisition to pursue its development, its chief executive said on Tuesday.
docs.snippet: French food group Danone does not need to make a large acquisition to pursue its development, its chief executive said on Tuesday.
